description: Indicates cases with aligned legal interpretations across different jurisdictions (e.g., Bangladesh, India, Pakistan), showing harmonized jurisprudence

jurisdictions.description: List of jurisdictions involved in the harmonization

principle.description: Shared legal principle or interpretation that is harmonized
examples: Right to life includes right to livelihood
Natural justice requires hearing before adverse action
Delegated legislation must be within statutory limits

reasoning_similarity.description: Similarity score of legal reasoning between cases (0-1)

harmonized_by.description: Case citation or reference that explicitly harmonized these interpretations

common_statute.description: Statute or constitutional provision interpreted consistently across jurisdictions

harmonization_date.description: Date when harmonization was recognized or established

indexes: CREATE INDEX harmonized_jurisdictions IF NOT EXISTS FOR ()-[r:HARMONIZED_WITH]-() ON (r.jurisdictions)
CREATE INDEX harmonized_similarity IF NOT EXISTS FOR ()-[r:HARMONIZED_WITH]-() ON (r.reasoning_similarity)

examples.description: Bangladesh and India harmonized on fundamental rights interpretation

properties.principle: Right to life under Article 32 includes right to livelihood and dignity
properties.harmonized_by: Bangladesh SC in Rahman v. State (2020)
properties.notes: Both courts recognized that constitutional right to life must be interpreted broadly to include economic rights
